image.altText: A collage made up of photos of Ani and her sister, her sister Kinisimere, generic invoices and ants.

props.synopsis: From broken agreements to "filthy" practices, families and insiders share "horror stories" from inside Australia's problematic funeral industry.

title.children: 'Disgusting': Ex-employees allege 'filthy' practices at funeral home

image.altText: man wearing suit with press pack behind them

props.synopsis: As Syrians expressed obvious relief at the end of 54 years of one of the most brutal dictatorships of modern times, their neighbour Israel reacted in a very different way: it launched a bombing campaign of 480 strikes in 48 hours.

title.children: After one moment of joy in Syria comes saturation bombing and uncertainty

image.altText: Luigi Mangione wears an orange prison suit and is followed by a law enforcement officer.

props.synopsis: Accused murderer Luigi Mangione was carrying a notebook that outlined plans to kill a CEO when he was arrested at a McDonald's restaurant earlier this week, US media reports.

title.children: Luigi Mangione's notebook outlined plan to 'wack' a CEO: reports

image.altText: A blue Meta logo placed on the keyboard of a silver laptop

props.synopsis: Major disruptions to Meta's Facebook, Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp have cut off users from logging in and accessing the platforms.

title.children: Meta outage impacting Facebook, Instagram, Messenger and WhatsApp

image.altText: Two unidentified people sit at a desk with several boxes labelled MS-2 Step. One wears doctor's lab coat

props.synopsis: Family Planning Australia has analysed data on medical terminations across NSW, highlighting how access to abortion remains a postcode lottery.

title.children: One-third of NSW LGAs had no doctors providing medical abortions in 2022

image.altText: A person's thumb edges towards a Facebook app icon on a smartphone.

props.synopsis: The government wants Facebook and Google to pay for news after Meta refused to renew deals with media outlets. Follow live.

title.children: Fresh plan for tech giants to pay for Australian news

image.altText: A Rex aircraft seen through a window at an airport terminal, in the foreground inside are airport seats.

props.synopsis: Taking on Regional Express and four of its directors represents a change of attitude at the corporate regulator that has been missing in action for years, if not decades.

title.children: Taking aim at Rex represents a return to law enforcement for ASIC

image.altText: A young child with short dark hair and a dark top stands in front of a TV.

props.synopsis: From an awkward KFC commercial to a mobile billboard for a brothel, ad complaints from 2024 give insight into the direction the industry is taking.

title.children: KFC, Budget Direct and a brothel top 2024 ad-complaints list

image.altText: Mum hold two small boys on her lap.

props.synopsis: Early childhood educators have long argued for childcare to be viewed as vital for children’s wellbeing, now the voters will decide at next year’s election, writes Conor Duffy.

title.children: Ditching the 'activity test' makes childcare a right not a privilege

image.altText: A composite shows pictures of Rio Tinto and BHP signs atop tall buildings.

props.synopsis: Lawyers say hundreds of women have joined a lawsuit that alleges widespread and systemic sexual harassment and gender discrimination at Rio Tinto and BHP worksites.

title.children: Mining companies called out for using NDAs to 'blackmail' women

image.altText: Prince Abdulaziz bin Turki Al Faisal wearing white and brown robes and shawls while smiling with hands raised

props.synopsis: The Middle Eastern nation has won the right to host the tournament in 2034 despite major concerns migrant workers could die constructing the event.

title.children: Saudi Arabia to host FIFA World Cup despite sportswashing concerns

image.altText: A tomb on fire in the middle of a maeusoleum.

props.synopsis: Syrian rebels set fire to the mausoleum containing the tomb of Hafez al-Assad, located in the Latakia heartland of Assad's Alawite community.

title.children: Rebels set alight tomb of ousted Syrian president's father

image.altText: Chrsi Wray wearing a dark suit and blue tie with lips pursed as he looks up and leans to his right

props.synopsis: FBI director Chris Wray will step down from his position in January, after US president-elect Donald Trump signalled his intent to fire him and replace him with Kash Patel.

title.children: FBI director to step down before Trump administration takes power

image.altText: Wall Street traders in a happy mood.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is on track to open higher, following a record-breaking performance on Wall Street as megacap tech stocks like Amazon, Alphabet and Meta drove the Nasdaq to a record close above 20,000 points. Follow live.

title.children: Tech stocks drive Nasdaq to new record, ASX to rise

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Tesla shares hit record high, pushing Elon Musk's net worth to $602.8 billion
BHP and Rio Tinto called out for using NDAs to stop women talking about sexual harassment
Meta outage for Facebook, Instagram, Messenger and WhatsApp impacting users worldwide

image.altText: Spoons full of different coloured and shaped tablets and capsules on a pink background.

props.synopsis: A range of supplements from cinnamon to chromium claim to improve metabolism and lower blood sugar levels. What's the evidence for them?

title.children: Online scams are promoting diabetes supplements. But do they actually work?

image.altText: Geminid meteor shower in Northern Hemisphere.

props.synopsis: You'll have to get up super early this weekend to catch the best glimpse of Australia's best meteor shower before the Sun rises.

title.children: The best Australian meteor shower of the year peaks this weekend. Here's how to see it

image.altText: A family of five Syrian refugees sitting on a brown couch.

props.synopsis: The Alrahmo family has spent eight years making a life in Australia since fleeing war-torn Syria with their six children. Now the Bashar al-Assad regime has fallen, they finally feel safe enough to consider returning home to see loved ones.

title.children: Syrian refugee family hopeful of seeing loved ones after fall of Assad

image.altText: Israel graffitti

props.synopsis: It comes after anti-Israel vandalism was graffitied in Sydney's east, which is home to one of Australia's largest Jewish communities.

title.children: High police presence at Jewish sites, Sydney in 'heightened' period of concern

image.altText: Ashleigh Gardner of Australia is congratulated by teammates after dismissing Smriti Mandhana

props.synopsis: Annabel Sutherland reaches her second ODI century with a booming strike, having dragged Australia out of a tricky spot to set India 299 to win the third ODI at the WACA.

title.children: Ash Gardner sparks Indian batting collapse as Australia complete series sweep

image.altText: A composite image of a young man sitting down in a police uniform and a young woman smiling.

props.synopsis: The families of two police officers murdered by extremists are calling on Queensland police to improve safety measures, two years on from their "senseless and evil" deaths.

title.children: Families mark two years since 'senseless and evil' Wieambilla murders

image.altText: A man in a navy suit sits in a chair as he is interviewed for television.

props.synopsis: Australia's most senior private security specialist has been targeted in raids conducted by ASIO and the Australian Federal Police that appear to have been prompted at least in part by his media appearances, including on the ABC's Four Corners program.

title.children: Ex-intelligence officer raided by ASIO after Four Corners appearance

image.altText: A whole barramundi cooked on a BBQ

props.synopsis: Gulf fishers are delighting in the best barramundi season they’ve seen and bumper prawn hauls – and that's good news for festive tables.

title.children: Queensland's big rains drive seafood bonanza for Christmas feasts

image.altText: Bucket of brown, murky water sitting under an outdoor tap. It looks disgusting.

props.synopsis: The last upgrade of the Yass Valley's water treatment plant was in 1990, with residents dealing with ongoing issues with the quality of their water.

title.children: Water upgrades coming for region where most won't drink from the tap

image.altText: A dog swims in ankle deep water at a beach on a sunny day

props.synopsis: Perth is experiencing its first heatwave of the summer, as the temperature surpassed 40 degrees Celsius for the first time since February.

title.children: Perth hit by first heatwave of season as mercury tops 40C

image.altText: A man in a hat takes a photograph of a buggy racing through the desert.

props.synopsis: The organisers of the Finke Desert Race have settled a lawsuit over a crash that left a spectator dead and another seriously injured.

title.children: Finke Desert Race organisers reach settlement over fatal 2021 crash

image.altText: A chain of mostly transparent bioluminescent organisms glowing blue

props.synopsis: While they may not look like it, salps are more closely related to humans than they are to jellyfish. The extraordinary numbers of them accumulating at Tasmanian beaches have delighted biologists.

title.children: 'Born at midnight, by noon it's a parent': The weird creature swarming Tasmanian beaches

image.altText: A close-up shows a man with a dark black beard and a turban looking serious.

props.synopsis: A suicide bombing in the Afghan capital killed the Taliban's refugee minister Khalil Haqqani, according to Interior Ministry officials.

title.children: Taliban refugee minister killed in Kabul suicide bombing

image.altText: A girl and her family.

props.synopsis: After an exam period marred by controversy, Victorian students receive their VCE exam results, with 41 Victorian students achieving the highest possible ATAR rank of 99.95.

title.children: Mixed emotions as VCE results arrive after exams marred by controversy

image.altText: David Warner holds a cricket bat while standing with Shane Warne, in Melbourne Stars kit, at the MCG.

props.synopsis: With the Big Bash struggling to attract international stars, David Warner's return to the competition full-time could be exactly what the league needs.

title.children: The BBL needs another 'Shane Warne moment' and this season could be it

image.altText: Lani Pallister holds up her hands

props.synopsis: Lani Pallister has won the 800m freestyle and Alex Perkins has taken bronze in the 50m butterfly as Australia shone at the World Short Course Championships.

title.children: Pallister credits mum after blitzing field to claim gold at world champs

image.altText: Ship banned from Australia.

props.synopsis: A Netherlands ship has been temporarily banned from entering Australian ports because it failed to safely store the chemical which caused the Beirut Port explosion.

title.children: Safety authority bans foreign ship for risky dangerous chemical storage

image.altText: CCTV footage of mystery man

props.synopsis: The unidentified man was last seen alive in a hardware store. Police believe he is from overseas and they hope a relatively new DNA technique can help solve the mystery.

title.children: Mystery remains a year after man's body washed up in a Queensland river

image.altText: The playground of Darlington Public School.

props.synopsis: Darlington Public School in Sydney's inner west has been awarded the World Building of the Year at the 2024 World Architectural Festival for its small yet mighty design.

title.children: Sydney public school wins World Building of the Year architecture award
